oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pharmacokinetics of tulathromycin following administration with remote delivery devices
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rivera, J. D.
Woolums, A. R.
Giguere, S.
Johnson, J. T.
Lutz, A. G.
Tipton, P. N.
Crosby, W.
Hice, I.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: injection
remote delivery devices
ROD
dart guns
antimicrobials
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Remote delivery devices (ROD, aka dart guns) are used to administer antimicrobials (AM) to cattle in situations when individual treatment by manual injection is logistically difficult. However, it is not clear whether the pharmacokinetics (PK) of AM administered by remote delivery device is comparable to that for AM administered by injection; thus it is not certain that cattle treated by ROD experience equivalent AM effect.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2018; 311
